DataElement.preferredName: Patient Histologic Confirmation Metastatic Or Unresectable Malignant Neoplasm Requirement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating that a patient's histologically confirmed diagnosis of metastatic or unresectable malignancy meets the criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Histologically Confirmation Metastatic Or Unresectable Malignant Neoplasm Requirement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Involving the use of histology or histological techniques._Having been established or verified._A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Unable to be removed with surgery._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Histologically Confirmation Metastatic Or Unresectable Malignant Neoplasm Requirement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques.:Having been established or verified.:A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Unable to be removed with surgery.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Not capable of being removed by surgery.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have: histologic
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have: histologically confirmed, metastatic or unresectable malignancy of the following types: (a) non-squamous, non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), (b) triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC; defined by ER less than 1%, PR less than 1% and HER2 IHC: 1+ or less; if 2+, a negative FISH testing is required) without germline BRCA mutation, (c) pancreatic adenocarcinoma (PDAC), or (d) small cell lung cancer (SCLC)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically documented unresectable stage III or IV triple negative breast cancer (TNBC) and a known BRCA 1/2 mutation is present?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in Phase I: Does patient have histologically confirmed malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed, metastatic or unresectable malignancy of the following types: (a) non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), (b) triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC; defined by ER<1%, PR<1% and HER2 1+ or less by IHC; if HER-2 expression is 2+, a negative FISH testing is required) (c) pancreatic adenocarcinoma (PDAC), or (d) small cell lung cancer (SCLC)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically documented unresectable locally advanced or metastatic non-HER2-positive breast cancer and a known BRCA 1/2 mutation present?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose Expansion Cohorts: Does patient have biopsy proven metastatic or unresectable SCLC, PD-NEC (any extrapulmonary neuroendocrine carcinoma with small cell or large cell histology) or PDA and has progressed on at least one line of standard therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is in the dose escalation phase, does patient have histologically confirmed malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have either histologically confirmed malignancy that is radiologically evaluable and metastatic or unresectable OR a malignancy for which a PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitor has been approved in the adjuvant setting?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic and/or recurrent solid tumors (therapy naive or those with prior therapy) with pathogenic BRCA 1/2 mutated cancers where olaparib is indicated as standard of care therapeutic option (not maintenance)?
